page.title: 01Friston Forest and villages.
page.content: This is an area of outstanding natural beauty.Litlington is a village in East Sussex with a population of 114. Litlington is on a minor road between Wilmington and Exceat.It is half a mile from the River Cuckmere and adjoins open country leading to Lullington Heath Nature Reserve.West Dean has only 60 residents,it has no through road and is surrounded by several acres of Friston Forest.Part of the South Downs Way,a long distance path from Eastbourne to Buriton, Hampshire,goes through West Dean and Litlington.The A259 road from Seaford to Eastbourne climbs at Exceat Hill alongside Friston Forest.A footpath leads from the road to West Dean. Adjacent to the B2105 road from Polegate to Friston is a picnic area at Butchershole Bottom leading into Friston Forest.
